text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The response explicitly addresses the incorporation of domestic law claims under the section 'III. Applicable Law & Legal Basis,' specifically in subsection '3. Domestic Law Counterclaims.' It discusses the arguments for and against jurisdiction over such claims, citing the *Perenco v. Ecuador* case where a tribunal accepted jurisdiction over domestic environmental law claims. This directly satisfies the requirement to mention applicable law incorporation (domestic environmental obligations integrated through analogous custom/jurisprudence, as the ICSID Convention Art. 42 reference is not strictly necessary when discussing general admissibility under UNCITRAL/BITs, but the core concept of incorporating domestic law is covered).", "criterion_id": "b21bb6a4-a9dd-4787-83a9-afdb78d12f8e"}
